FormFieldChangeHandler.value: (  e: ChangeEvent | null,  value: any) => void | boolean;

className.comment: CSS class name(s) to be applied to the component

children.comment: Text or child elements to be displayed inside the button

loading.comment: Whether the button should be in a loading state

checked.comment: Whether the button should be in a checked state

square.comment: Whether the button should have a square shape

prefixElem.comment: Element to be prepended to the children

postfixElem.comment: Element to be appended to the children

label.comment:
Used to associate the checkbox with its label.
This allows users to click on the label instead of the small checkbox,
which can be especially helpful for users with mobility or vision impairments.

It can also improve the SEO of the page,
as search engines can use the label text to better understand the content of the page.

checked.comment: Whether the checkbox is currently selected

error.comment: Defines an error message or error status for the input field

value.comment:
Date and time to display.

If no value is provided, the component will default to the current date and time.

format.comment: format in which to display the date and time. If no format is provided, the component will display the date and time using the default format.

locale.comment: locale in which to display the date and time. If no locale is provided, the component will default to 'en' (English).

isValid.comment: Whether the form is currently valid.

errors.comment: Validation errors for the form fields.

isDirty.comment: Whether any form field values have changed.

isLoading.comment: Whether the form is currently submitting.

touched.comment: Whether each form field has been touched by the user.

changed.comment: Whether each form field value has changed.

setValue.comment: Set the value of a specific form field.

setValues.comment: Set the values of all form fields.

reset.comment: Reset the form to its initial state.

Field.comment: React component used to render individual form fields.

defaultValues.comment: Default values for the form fields.

initialValues.comment: Initial values for the form fields.

validationSchema.comment:
Schema for validating the form fields.
This schema is defined using the [fastest-validator](https://www.npmjs.com/package/fastest-validator) library.

markEdited.comment: Mark fields as edited when they are changed.

children.comment: Render prop function that receives the form API as an argument and returns the form custom layout for the form fields.

onInit.comment: Called after the form is initialized.

onChange.comment: Called whenever the form values change and receives the current form values as an argument.

onSubmit.comment:
Called when the form is submitted and receives the current form values as an argument

It should return a promise that resolves when the submission is complete to properly update isLoading state.

name.comment:
Name of the form field.

Used to manage states the form field, such as value, error, touched, changed, etc.

e.comment:
Called when the form field is lost focus.

If the function returns false, the field will not be marked as touched.

markEdited.comment: Whether to display the dot indicating that the field has been edited.

isHidden.comment: Do not render component if true.

component.comment: Component used to render the form field.

children.comment: Additional content to render below the form field.

isChanged.comment: Whether the form field value has changed.

isTouched.comment: Whether the form field has been touched by the user.

clearMargins.comment:
Every form field has margin-top to separate it from the previous field.

Use clearMargins:false to remove margins from the form field.

handleChange.comment: Called when the form field value changes.

handleBlur.comment: Called when the form field is lost focus.

items.comment: Items to be displayed in the gallery.

animation.comment: Whether to enable animation when transitioning between items in the gallery.

startIndex.comment:
Index of the item to display first in the gallery.

If no index is provided, the first item in the items array will be displayed.

onChange.comment: Called when the active item in the gallery changes.

forceLabelOnTop.comment:
For label to be on top of the input,
even if there is no value/placeholder and not focused

error.comment: Defines an error message or error status for the input field

hasClear.comment: Whether the input field should include a clear button that clears the input value when clicked

changeOnEnd.comment: Whether the onChange event should be triggered only when the user finishes typing (focus lost) or immediately after each keystroke (default)

adornmentLeft.comment: Adornment to be displayed to the left of the input field

adornmentRight.comment: Adornment to be displayed to the right of the input field

onClear.comment: A callback function that is called when the input field's value is cleared using the clear button (if hasClear is true)

controlProps.comment: Additional props for the underlying HTML input element

checkAutofill.comment: Whether to check for autofill values and update the input field's value accordingly

upload.comment:
Function that uploads the selected file and returns a Promise that
resolves with the URL of the uploaded file.

It takes three arguments:
- file - A File object representing the file to be uploaded.
- fn - A callback function that is called with an object containing the loaded and total progress values during the upload process.
- getXHR (optional) - A function that is called with an XMLHttpRequest object representing the underlying request. This can be used to set custom headers or other options on the request.

uploadOnDemand.comment:
Callback that allows the caller to trigger an upload of selected files.

It takes a function as an argument, which should be called with the upload function as its argument.

This function can be used to trigger an upload after the user has made their selections.

limit.comment: Maximum file size allowed in megabytes

maxCount.comment: Maximum number of files allowed to be uploaded

onSelect.comment:
Callback that is called when the upload is complete.
It takes two arguments:
- e - ChangeEvent
- value - URLs of uploaded files

onChange.comment: Callback that is called with an array of File objects representing the selected file(s).

remove.comment:
A function that removes the file from the server.
It takes a string representing the name of the file to be removed and returns a Promise that resolves with a boolean value indicating whether the removal was successful or not

loader.comment: Function that returns a Promise which resolves to the content to be lazy loaded.

progressElem.comment: Element that will be rendered while the content is loading.

onClose.comment:
Called when the lightbox is closed.

By default it closed by pressing Esc key.

children.comment: The content to display in the lightbox.

show.comment:
Show a notification based on the given params.

Returns the id of the notification that can be used for close(id) and remove(id) methods.

pause.comment:
Will pause hiding the notification.

By default hover on notification item will set to pause.

unpause.comment: Will resume to the timeouts to hide the notification.

close.comment: Gracefully hide the notification with an animation.

remove.comment: Immediately remove the notification without any animation.

isOpen.comment: Sets the initial open state (default is false)

focusControl.comment:
Toggle open/close state on focus/blur

Also by pressing Enter/Space keys, when focus on trigger

inline.comment: Renders inline with its trigger element

direction.comment:
Direction to open.

If not specified, it will be automatically calculated.

Also when size of content changes, it will be recalculated.

wrapperProps.comment: Props for element that wraps content

onOpen.comment: Function called when the popup is opened

onClose.comment: Function called when the popup is closed

exactClassName.comment: CSS class name that will be added to the link when it is active.

isPartialExact.comment: Whether the link should be considered active if the current URL partially matches the link's destination URL.

isDisabled.comment: Whether the link should be disabled and unclickable.

isClear.comment: Whether the link should be rendered without underline.

inline.comment: Whether the link should be rendered without paddings.

onClick.comment: Called when the link is clicked.

children.comment: Every child of Router component must have `path` property.

rootPath.comment: Used in [Link](//components/Link) component to generate correct href for relative paths.

innerClassName.comment: CSS class to apply to the inner container element

thumbClassName.comment: CSS class to apply to the scrollbar thumb element

innerProps.comment: Additional HTML attributes to apply to the inner container element

onInnerRef.comment: Callback to get a reference to the inner container element

extraWide.comment: Whether to display an extra-wide scrollbar thumb.

autoHide.comment: Whether to automatically hide the scrollbar when not in use (default false).

offset.comment: Offset to apply to the scrollbar.

onScroll.comment: Called when the <Scroll> component is scrolled.

isOpen.comment: Use this prop to control the open state

optionsClassName.comment: CSS class for styling the list items wrapper

optionClassName.comment: CSS class that will be applied to every list options

additionalLabel.comment: ReactNode that will be added to to label

additionalOptions.comment: Options that would be added to the top of the list

presets.comment: Presets are a set of options that can be selected with a single click

value.comment:
Id(s) of selected item(s)

Pass array for multiple selection

expandSelected.comment: Expand selected items on first open

isSearchable.comment: Whether to show the search input field

optionsTreeUpd.comment: store in state to receive updates

dataField.comment:
Name of the field in the Data object to render column content.

If not specified, the `id` field will be used by default.

render.comment:
Function that takes in a Data object and returns a ReactNode representing the content to be displayed in this column for that row.

If not specified, the default behavior is to display the value of the corresponding dataField property.

columns.comment: Config that describes the structure of the table

isLoading.comment: Whether the table data is in loading state

style.comment: inline style to be applied to the item container.

wrapElem.comment:
DOM element that wraps the list of items.

This is used to calculate the viewport dimensions and to handle scroll events.

itemHeight.comment: height of each item in the list.

itemsCount.comment: Number of items to be rendered in the list.

totalCount.comment: total number of items in the list

overlapCount.comment: number of items to be rendered before and after the visible viewport.

pageSize.comment:
number of items to be rendered at a time.

used to determine when the list has been scrolled to the end.

offsetBefore.comment: number of items to be rendered before the visible viewport.

offsetAfter.comment: number of items to be rendered after the visible viewport.

initialScrollTop.comment: initial scroll position of the list.

scrollTop.comment: current scroll position of the list.

onScroll.comment: called when the list is scrolled.

onScrollEnd.comment: called when the list has been scrolled to the end.

children.comment: function that renders the list of items

renderItem.comment: function that renders an individual item in the list

getItemProps.comment: function that returns an object containing any additional props to be passed to each item in the list, based on the item index and any offsets.
